name: Losing CTRL (IndieBurg, Laura, littleBugHunter)
description:
As part of the GMTK GameJam 2020 part of our team decided to participate and came up with this little game.

Ctrl+C Ctrl+V your way through this little Puzzle Game and help a robot friend navigate through different levels.

In "Losing Control" you help a little robot through a world that is falling apart only using his ability to copy and paste. You can select parts or the whole level by clicking and dragging on desktop or using the on screen buttons and touch on mobile browsers.

How to play

GOAL of the game is to lead the little ROBOT to the end of each level.

You can MOVE by using the ARROW KEYS or WASD and mobile users can use TOUCH and the KEYS ON SCREEN.

The world of Losing Control is breaking apart but the purple bot has the special ability to COPY and PASTE parts of the level like shown below.

There is only a limited amount of CTRL keys to solve each level. So be careful what you use them for. CTRL+C to copy and CTRL+V to paste affect not only the regular floor tiles but also duplicate the VOID surrounding the broken paths. Special Tiles like the END, LAVA, PICK UPS and the ROBOT itself can't be pasted or overwritten.

What about the lava, you say?`

Sometimes the floor is LAVA and it spreads each time you move the little robot.

Some levels come with additional CTRL keys to collect, when you walk over them.

Now you know everything you need to solve this little puzzle game!

Good Luck and don't lose control!
